description: My hobby projects, most of them are Next.js apps deployed to Vercel.
intro: I’m a senior majoring in Computer Science and Engineering specializing in Artificial Intelligence with a Mathematics minor (GPA 3.73). Experienced in deep learning, computer vision, and full-stack development through research, academic, and personal projects. I’m passionate about exploring how intelligent systems learn and adapt. I’m currently seeking entry-level opportunities for after I graduate this May.

experience.description: Building and deploying web apps using Next.js, Vercel, and serverless APIs. Focus on performance and UX.
Worked on the web platform, components library and design-system integrations.

research.title: BASKET120: A High-Fidelity Video Benchmark for Motion-Driven and Explainable Person Re-Identification
research.description: Introduced BASKET120, a dataset of 120 basketball player identities (≈40 videos per identity, ~5,000 clips) with paired appearance and motion samples and silhouette annotations to emphasize motion cues. Demonstrated that motion-based models adapted from video action recognition can discriminate identity and provided explainable analyses of key motion characteristics.
contributions: Collected and organized high-fidelity motion video data for the BASKET120 dataset.
Performed segmentation labeling and validation to isolate motion cues from appearance features.
Supported data preprocessing and dataset quality assurance within the Imageomics Institute research workflow.

research.title: Machine Learning for Code Synthesis
research.description: Explored transformer models for code generation, fine-tuning strategies, and evaluation metrics for code quality and security.

research.title: Human-Computer Interaction Study
research.description: Studied developer workflows and tooling adoption, focusing on productivity and accessibility improvements.

portfolioProjects.name: Portfolio Website
portfolioProjects.description: This very site — a Next.js portfolio showcasing projects, deployed to Vercel with a focus on performance and UX.

portfolioProjects.name: MRI Image Segmentation
portfolioProjects.description: Implemented U-Net in PyTorch to segment tumors on MRI brain scans.
highlights: Implemented U-Net in PyTorch to segment tumors on MRI brain scans.
Experimented with multiple architectures and training strategies; finalized model achieved a dice score of 0.87.
Strengthened knowledge of computer vision best practices and medical imaging applications.

portfolioProjects.name: YouTube-Clone-FullStack
portfolioProjects.description: Full-stack YouTube clone (Next.js client + services) with video upload, processing, and streaming components.
highlights: Next.js web client with Firebase authentication
Video processing service that transcodes uploaded videos (example: 360p conversion)
Uses Google Cloud Storage, Cloud Pub/Sub and Firebase functions for scalable upload/processing pipeline

portfolioProjects.name: Algorithmic Trading with Python
portfolioProjects.description: Collection of Jupyter Notebook projects demonstrating algorithmic trading strategies using IEX Cloud and Python.
highlights: Three strategy templates: Equal-Weight S&P500, Quantitative Momentum, Quantitative Value
Implemented data retrieval and strategy logic in Jupyter Notebooks; outputs include visualization and XML exports
Based on industry tutorials and adapted for robustness and analysis

portfolioProjects.name: Retro Zelda Game (Remake)
portfolioProjects.description: A retro-style Zelda-like 2D game remake. Includes collectibles, gates, and a gameplay timer. Gameplay sample embedded below.
highlights: 2D animated character with sound effects and background music
Gameplay mechanics: collect 3 keys, open gates, reach treasure
Game clock for timing runs; designed for replayability and speed runs
